Sentencas: An extended surface modeling concept (electrochemical fin) is applied to charge transport within the SOFC electrode microstructure using an analytical modeling approach analogous to thermal fin analysis.
Titulo: Analytical investigations of varying cross section microstructures on charge transfer in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: This model is distinct from similar approaches applied to SOFC electrode microstructure in its application of a governing equation that allows for variable cross-section geometry.
Titulo: Analytical investigations of varying cross section microstructures on charge transfer in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: The model presented is capable of replicating experimentally observed electrode behavior inclusive of sensitivity to microstructural geometry, which stands in contrast to existing models that apply governing equations analogous to a constant cross-section thermal fin equation.
Titulo: Analytical investigations of varying cross section microstructures on charge transfer in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: Insights learned from this study include: the establishment of a suite of dimensionless parameters and performance metrics that can be applied to assess electrode microstructure, the definition of microstructure-related transport regimes relevant to electrode design, and correlations that allow performance predictions for electrodes that provide cell structural support.
Titulo: Analytical investigations of varying cross section microstructures on charge transfer in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: Of particular note, the variable cross-section modeling approach motivates the definition of a sintering quality parameter that quantifies the degree of constriction within the conducting network of the electrode, a phenomenon that exerts influence over electrode polarization.
Titulo: Analytical investigations of varying cross section microstructures on charge transfer in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: One-dimensional models are presented for electrochemical fins of several cross-sectional geometries with the ultimate goal of developing a general tool that enables the prompt performance evaluation of electrode microstructures.
Titulo: Analytical investigations of varying cross section microstructures on charge transfer in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes

Sentencas: Such a tool would facilitate SOFC microstructural design by focusing more detailed modeling efforts on the most promising microstructures.
Titulo: Analytical investigations of varying cross section microstructures on charge transfer in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes
Analytical investigations of varying cross section microstructures on charge transfer in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes
